\
Being a Hand-Book for Tailors\
\

Robes and furr’d gowns hide all.\\"\
\

16. Updates"

"A NOTE TO THE READER\
\
When man first thought himself different from the beasts, he clad himself in rude coverings; and thus is tailoring the oldest of the human crafts. While any might through rude hides and long-twined leaves over their naked selves, it is by the agency of tailoring that man and women are better clad, and their betters clad the best of all. Tailors possess the skill, instinct and learning required to create, alter and change to custom the many common types of clothing found in the Castle, including shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and gowns.\
\
Not all clothing items will succumb to the scissors of a tailor. Shoes, boots and other footwear require the skills of a cobbler. Gloves and handwear are the province of a glover, while hats and headwear are the speciality of the hatter. An experienced dyer is required to change the color of an item; and the application of custom symbols requires the services of an embroiderer. Many tailors will learn several of these ancillary skills as well as their basic, primal trade.\
\
Tailors should in all cases be aware of the sumptuary prohibitions expressed in the Capitulary, regarding the prohibitions on certain fabrics. While the penalty of these misdemeanors will fall upon the wearers, it is no doubt true that Her Majesty's ministers will be displeased with any tailor foolish enough to provide the garb that fit the criminal."

"A FEW WORDS ON MATERIAL\
\
Tailors practice their noble artistry upon two of the most fundamental qualities of clothing, MATERIAL and FIT.\
\
The material or fabric of a garment defines its texture and feel, and also speaks of the skill of the artist and the taste of the wearer. Over thirty different fabrics are available in the Castle, some rare and some difficult to employ. Novices work with common materials such as burlap or linen, while more experienced artisans gain access to more exotic fabrics including silk, lizardskin or even spun glass!"

"ON FIT\
\
It is ideal that clothing fit the man, as the man will rarely consent to be altered to fit the clothing. The more the clothing fits, the better the quality of the relationship between a clothing item and its wearer. Novices must work hard to achieve even a crude or awkward fit; but after patient training, the serious student will be able to attain more desireable appearances, and can achieve a flattering or tasteful fit."

"DEGREES OF PROFICIENCY\
\
Ten levels of proficiency may be recognized for the craft of Tailoring:\
\
1. Novice\
2. Junior Apprentice\
3. Senior Apprentice\
4. Fellowcraft\
5. Journeyman\
6. Artisan\
7. Senior Artisan\
8. Master\
9. Master Adept\
10. Grand Master\
\
A Novice tailor possesses very limited ability, and should attempt only a few rudimentary alterations. As skill increases, however, many more possibilities become apparent to the seasoned eye. A Master might command dozens of alteration options.\
\
This hand-book describes, in brief, the alteration options available to tailors at each level of proficiency."

"NOVICE\
\
Novices are the least experienced of tailors; their effects are rather limited and uninspiring.\
\
They might employ the simplest materials, such as: none, burlap, homespun, or linen.\
\
They produce garments whose fit might be characterized as: none, crude, awkward, or tasteless. In fact, they would be wise to avoid altering the fit of established patterns."

"JUNIOR APPRENTICE\
\
A Junior Apprentice can manage a bit more than a Novice, but their additional skills can hardly be called impressive.\
\
The materials of canvas, cotton, gauze, worsted and broadcloth might be employed.\
\
They produce garb whose fit is only careless, indifferent, or hurried."

"SENIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Senior Apprentices have attained sufficient skill to produce a handful of modest but useful alterations.\
\
They sometimes work in hemp, muslin, flannel, wool or felt.\
\
The Senior Apprentice can create costume whose fit might be adequate, loose, or tight."

"FELLOWCRAFT\
\
Fellowcraft Tailors have spent many hours learning their trade, thereby earning the right to apply a personal mark of excellence onto items they create.\
\
They add leather, lawn, brocade and tweed to those materials which they use.\
\
The fit of their products will be trim, tasteful, conservative or jaunty."

"JOURNEYMAN\
\
Journeymen possess the confidence to produce fashionable and significantly appealing garments.\
\
They work in suede, velveteen and basic fur.\
\
The garments they produce will be attractive, modest, revealing or handsome."

"ARTISAN\
\
Artisans are capable of the fine control needed to handle some of the more challenging fabrics and styles.\
\
The fabrics employed by Artisans include calfskin, satin, lace and cheviot.\
\
The fit of their garments will be classical, provocative, flattering or fine."

"SENIOR ARTISAN\
\
Senior Artisans are sought by those desiring finely-made apparel in rare fabrics. They often serve as assistants to Master Tailors.\
\
Fabrics of serge, damask and velour are theirs to employ.\
\
Any Senior Artisan's garments may be elegant, cunning, stylish or dashing."

"MASTER\
\
Masters are the virtuosi of the tailor's art. Their long career of study and craftsmanship has earned them the ability to work with materials and styles of the most rarified quality. They can also alter the material and fit of clothing items that have already been altered.\
\
The material in which Masters work include lambskin, lizardskin, silverweave and challis.\
\
The fit of a Master's garments can be exquisite, graceful, beautiful or daring."

"MASTER ADEPT\
\
Master Adepts have spend innumerable seasons clothing the most perceptive and fashionable residents of the Castle. They employ particularly splendid fabrics -- silk, samite, velvet or goldweave -- in creating garments of perfect, immaculate, or sublime fit."

"GRAND MASTER\
\
Tailors working at the rank of Grand Master are not often seen in the Castle; rare indeed are those who attain this level of perfection. Their garments are almost exclusively worn by royalty.\
\
They produce garments in the most bizarre and unwordly fabrics, such as iridescent, diaphanous or glassweave.\
\
The Grand Master may produce a garment whose fit is exactly, truly divine."

"UPDATES\
\
As fashion changes and the arts of the weavers and dyers grow, the choices available to tailors within the Castle will change. The text of this book will mysteriously update itself as new choices become available. More experienced tailors will inform you if and when updates occur.\
\
Please bring typographical errors or other textual problems found in this volume to the attention of your instructor."
